description: I had some beers to burn off, and the sun was out. That means one thing (apparently): 9th place overall on Ben Vorlich. I sort of needed to go for this after the last two runs of Vorlich, both after fairly large projs. Okay sure, anyone actually fast would record the route as a trail run but still, after a night on the dunkels, I will take it. We shot off in the morn in the bluebird sunshine to Inveruglas expecting a nice relaxed Sunday proj. But when we made it to that staircase motorway, I couldn't hold back. No stopping, not even for water, until the summit. And it was so worth it. I felt human again. All round it was a great day, not just because of the 9th place, but to have some of the squad rounded back up, to be back in the warmth of the sunshine for the second day in a row, and to gain some life on what can easily be a mundane Sunday. It was also the first project of the year to summit and return from with dry boots. Thats one of the minor beauties of the classic tourist tracks.
